content: today we're gonna do a quick little
project it's a nice embellishment for your war game table now this is a very
short episode and I know that this caters to a real niche section of my
subscribers so I'm not going to be charging on patreon or anything think of
this as a quick freebie back to terrain making next week so let's make an Aquila
placard first download the template from the link in the description below the
video print it out and cut out the pieces then
we'll use our trusty medium chipboard again if you're new to the channel I use
this a lot because it's sturdy rigid and really cheap you can buy it through me
as an Amazon affiliate using the link in the description below so trace the
patterns onto the chipboard and then cut them out for best results use a metal
ruler and a fresh utility knife or a box cutter or something like that dry fit
them to make sure everything's nice and symmetric and then hot glue them to the
base one by one paetynn however you like I hit it with
some leftover metallic spray it's been on my garage for like five years and
then I applied a black wash to the crevices it's just 50/50 water and cheap
acrylic craft paint so a few weeks ago I drove my buddy Jason's house with my
tools and I helped him build an 8 by 4 gaming table an area is like a tool
anyway at the end I surprised him with this piece and attached it to the table
skirt simply using loops of Basking tape on the back which was plenty strong
enough nice embellishment for your table
actually to not do this would be heresy so item Y lock thank you for joining me
and I'll see you next time
you
